channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Lab-grown diamonds are crushing this African economy that was built on natural stones
item.description: In September, Botswana’s national statistics agency reported a 43% drop in diamond output in the second quarter, the steepest fall in the country’s mo...

item.title: Despite their ‘no limits’ friendship, Russia is paying a nearly 90% markup on sanctioned goods from China — compared to 9% from other countries
item.description: While the value of Chinese ball-bearing exports to Russia jumped by 76% from 2021 to 2024, the quantity of exports actually dropped by 13%.

item.title: Northwestern will pay Trump admin $75 million to settle antisemitism cases and restore funding while agreeing to ‘socialize international students’
item.description: The Trump administration had frozen $790 million in grants that contributed to university layoffs and the resignation of the university's president in...

item.title: Even the Pope couldn’t avoid the Airbus software fix that disrupted flights across the world
item.description: An analysis found computer code that may have contributed to a sudden drop in the altitude of a JetBlue plane last month.

item.title: Santa is coming to Wall Street early this season, and analysts say 2026 is shaping up to be another big year of gains
item.description: Deutsche Bank predicted the S&P 500 will finish next year at 8,000, representing a 17% jump from Friday's close.
